name: Hard Famous Children Quiz / Test | Mixed People | 10 Questions

questions.text: Alice Liddell is famous through her connection with what writer?
questions.explanation:
Lewis Carroll.

	Yes, she was the "inspiration" for "Alice in Wonderland". Dodgson seemed to be attracted to young, innocent girls.

questions.text: Mozart was a child prodigy; his father was a towering presence in his life. What was the father's name?
questions.explanation:
Leopold.

	Early brilliance, early death. (Go see "Amadeus".)

questions.text: The "little princes" were imprisoned in the Tower of London. What is the name of he King who is said to be responsible for their imprisonment - and murder?
questions.explanation:
Richard.

	Richard III. It's not certain if Richard was a monster who imprisoned the doomed little boys. (Consult your Shakespeare for one version of his character.)

questions.text: Shirley Temple was a huge star who had a profound effect on the financial well-being of her studio. Which studio was it?
questions.explanation:
Fox.

	Almost all of her films were made for Fox - and her movies brought in tons of of money for the studio. Then, she walked away.

questions.text: "A little child shall lead them" is a well-known line that is taken from the bible. What section?
questions.explanation:
Isaiah.

	The line has often been quoted.

questions.text: The discovery of the tomb of King Tut made huge headlines. Who was the discoverer?
questions.explanation:
Howard Carter.

	Was the boy king murdered? Is there a curse on those who disturb the tomb? Lord Carnarvon (who was a member of Carter's "team") died "mysteriously".

questions.text: Which Judy Garland movie does NOT include Mickey Rooney in the cast?
questions.explanation:
For Me and My Gal.

	That one was with Gene Kelly. Garland and Rooney worked together many times successfully - and had successes when working alone, too. Rooney has had a long career - but the huge success of the early early days of Judy Garland and Andy Hardy was never equalled. Garland had a tough life, despite the fame and talent.

questions.text: Harold Gray created a famous young child. In what format?
questions.explanation:
Comic Strip.

	He wrote the "Little Orphan Annie" comic strip. It endured.

questions.text: Joan of Arc led an army to victory - but paid the ultimate price in the end for her heroic feats. When did she accomplish her deeds?
questions.explanation:
1400's.

	Her short life covered only a small part of the first half of the fifteenth century. Divine - or crazy?

questions.text: Little Eva is associated with what writer?
questions.explanation:
Harriet Beecher Stowe.

	"Uncle Tom's Cabin". (Dickens would be "Little Dorrit".)
